headline: Stable job, you can stand out easily if you are smart
pros:
- Your peers are less competitive compared to top-end commercial bankers in Hong Kong, who are graduate from prestige schools
- Handsome bonus based on your base salary
- Good to start this role as an external hire rather than an internal hire
cons:
- You have to be a patriot and be prepared to support any patriotic events
- Hard to jump out from Chinese Banks to non-Chinese Banks
- Higher sales target pressure if you are not performing in other areas
- Chinese proposal instead of English
- Be cautious of people with strong Chinese tied and background

headline: Low salary, little mobility
pros:
Very cheap lunch and dinner provided by the company.
Not a lot of workload, and rather stable environment for retirement.
cons:
A lot of politics and redundant employees. Since chinese companies never lay off employees, some unproductive and low-skilled people get to stay and even be promoted. Probably because some people are getting too free, they start playing politics and gossips.

Strong hierarchy is everywhere, though colleagues come from MNC or with overseas academic background are generally more genial. Discrimination towards contract staff by perm staff exists.

Would not recommend to fresh graduates especially if you have good English skills/ energetic mindset.

headline: A big disaster! The worst company that I have worked for.
pros: nothing can tell, except a big and famous bank.
cons: Unfriendly managers/senior. You are only a tool for them to achieve their goals.  No training for new joiners and they suppose you can perform as an experienced staff.  Top down, micromanagement, finger-pointing and always unnesscarry reporting, which seriously ruin the working environment. As a Chinese bank, it is quite conservative. You could not give them some advise and have diffrent opinions, or you may be considered as not following instructions.  You must follow their own ways to do things. Office politics. High turnover rate. No project software makes things complicated. Poor benefits and no career path for contract staff.

headline: Terrible Management
pros: -won't get fired...because they need people and they are always hiring
cons:

- terrible seniors/managers who yell at people using bad words or even call the new joiners "brainless"
- OT EVERYDAY! (people need to request to leave on time, but managers can SAY NO to it) 
- High turnover rate
- don't welcome ideas/suggestions
- as a Chinese company, it does get political sometimes

> conclusion: don't waste your time here if you are still young and ambitious

cons:

headline: The worst company I have ever worked for
pros: Well known company brand name
cons: I worked in Bank of China for less than a year. It is a very traditional company and very political. My manager did not give any guidance nor direction at work. Moreover, she always yelled at me in front of the whole team, as she did the same to other staff. Further, she  always hold my work and neglect the deadline. There was no work life balance. My manager always kept me late at night. There were many occasions that she asked me to stay in the office and wait for her decision to proceed my work after she came back from yoga class.  The turnover rate is high as we all fed up by poor management.

headline: Credit Manager
pros: Fairly stable environment.  Reasonable salary level.  With canteen and the price is cheap.  A lot of business from the Mainland China.
cons: Many rules and procedures to follow.  Demanding boss and a lot of work to handle.  Limited promotion opportunities.

headline: Manager for customer services team
pros: Stable working environment, sufficient resources and trainings are provided. Most existing staffs are knowledgable. Organization is big, can gain support from branches in China for the need of daily work.
cons: High valued customer need special and extra care to serve. Client will expect more than your standard job requirement, it all depends on your relationship build up with client.

headline: BA
pros: Good environment and plenty of AL
cons: Too many Chinese and very stupid

headline: fair, but intensive
pros: stable, good bonus, bilingual, big company, career opportunities as the company expand rapidly in HK and decides to transform into a regional bank
cons: heavy work load, not friendly enough to employees, hierarchy, lack of efficiency, high turn over rate

headline: Short review
pros: Colleagues are nice and friendly
cons: Long working hours and tons of paper work

headline: Part-time job in summer break
pros: The hourly wage is reasonable
cons: Had to stand for a long time

headline: Hard to level up for local hires
pros:
Rarely get fired
Canteen food is served at very low cost
cons:
Out-of-date system
Hard to level up for local hires

headline: so far so good working environment
pros: Stable career but no much opportunity for non-Chinese, even Hong Kong People
cons: High Pressure, a lot of ad hoc works

headline: No work-life balance in retail banking
pros: You can gain 1 year experience here and seek for similar jobs at other banks
cons:
While CSO = teller, you can't imagine a teller need to work for 11+ hours
The queue is super long but BM/OH still requiring you to make referrals or selling rater than killing queue

headline: Relationship manager
pros: Many corporate clients will come to you, no need worry for target
cons: Bad package, mean senior management, and limited exposure

headline: Great company to be working at!
pros: Strong support by senior management with clear vision and strategy.
cons: No cons at all, everything is great!

headline: Programmer
pros:
- Reputation as working in a major local bank
- Learn the business logic
cons: They have really bad management culture, which mess up things and make everyone crazy and irritated! They are really bad at making schedules and plan!! What's more is that people there are really into playing politic.

headline: IT Manager
pros: The job is stable and many internal chances to develop career in different field. Good place for bank newbie. Many colleagues provide assistance.
cons: Workload is heavvy and no methidology in management for project, don't expect promotion unless you devote your every weekend and holiday

headline: Assistant Banking Manager
pros: Large Corporation with lots of internal transfer opportunities
cons: You never know the backgrounds of your colleagues

headline: Intern
pros: intensive work environment and nice colleagues
cons: long working hour, many tasks

headline: Contract
pros: big company and nice co-workers
cons:
hierarchy in the company
sometimes inefficient

headline: Assistant Personal Banking Manager
pros:
A good chance to speak Cantonese
It is good to train your communication skills
cons:
You have to deal with the cultural shock
You have to meet your target

headline: Great co-workers, yet subject to "big company syndrome"
pros: --> Will have a nice time working with friendly co-workers
cons:
--> Strong hierarchy style
--> OT compensation not guaranteed.

headline: GT
pros: Big Company, more chances. Staffs are all nice.
cons: not applicable. Just join the company

headline: Relationship Manager
pros: Stability, People are nice and easygoing
cons: Pay is not good, Old and conservative management style, Too local

headline: Operation manager
pros: People are nice. Stable that you will not have to worry about being fired.
cons: Low salary. Low increment even for promotion to a manager. Some staff are not contributing.

headline: Bureaucracy,
pros: Job security, nice colleagues and line manager, superb place for your pre-retirement life, exposure to large blue chips corporate, great support from ops
cons: Intensive workload, a lot of overtime work, underpaid, typical Chinese firm, cannot finish jobs effectively, no delegation, low job satisfaction

headline: Fine
pros:
1. Stable job security
2. Teammates are nice and helpful
cons:
1. Work overtime and support at home
2. Many ad hoc tasks
3. Need to work overnight for urgent tasks

headline: sasd
pros: Good working environment and training prepration
cons: old office building and not many things to do

headline: Relationship manager
pros: Stable, and show advantage in Hong Kong who is china background company
cons: busy, too wide range of product need to achieve

headline: Good work life balance
pros:
Good work life balance
Sense of humanity
cons:
Highly structured environment
Low career prospect and compensation

headline: Asistant manager
pros:
Canteen at CBD
Work scope is wide
cons: The Company is quite hierarchical so things may get inefficient

headline: Assistant Manager
pros:
I worked in accounting dept. You can learn many things at the beginning since it's a really big bank. You may have the opportunity to rotate to different teams.
Have a canteen with lots of nice dishes
Most of colleagues are nice and helpful
cons:
Workload are heavy sometimes.
Job became boring and duplicating when you get familiar about your tasks
Management is not reasonable. I was deferred for the promotion since I refused to transfer to a team I am not interested in.
Salary growth is lower compared with peers

headline: Average job
pros: Not much pressure, have a canteen, secure job
cons: Not much bonus, small salary increment, have to deal with mandarin-speaking-only colleague

headline: Customer Services Officer
pros: Coworkers are nice and helpful
cons: Lack of career opportunities and path

headline: Senior Officer
pros: great deal in FXtreading desk
cons: everyday same things deal with

headline: work-life balance, but chinese style, quite strict regulations
pros:
- really nice colleagues, not stressful, seldom laid off employees
- culture is ok, quite helpful colleagues and willing to teach you
- canteen in central office offers cheap breakfast/lunch/dinner
- work-life balance: for some departments in back office, it's really relaxed and the staff can get off work early
- front-line: even you can't meet targets, seniors will still encourage you to work hard and achieve better results in the next quarter
cons:
-  pay here is really drastically below-average, at least 30-50% lower when compared to the market average, which is a really discouraging level
 - really strict regulations, you need to have approvals from different departments and senior management, not a good point for front-line staff 
- slow promotion

headline: relaxed envirnoment / decent pay
pros:
-bosses are laid back
-hours are shorter than foreign firms in capital markets
cons:
-pay lesser than foreign firm
-work is not challenging
-chinese firm, very bureaucratic

headline: financial risk manager
pros: good benefit, cheap breakfast/lunch/dinner in canteen
cons: Some colleagues are not easy to communicate as their vision is narrow. Inter department meetings 's efficiency is low.

headline: senior manager
pros: good culture for life work balance
cons: less attractive on salary as well as promotion.

headline: Relationship Manager
pros: Big clients, well-organized, and smart & hard-working people get paid off.
cons: Incentive package not super competitive, strict internal regulations

headline: Experience from Internship in IBD
pros: People are all very kind and nice to work with. Great working condition and restaurant in the building. The working time is also good and not that crazy.
cons: The training for intern is not very professional and the projects are not as good as banks in America or Europe.

headline: get the offer of bank of china hong kong
pros: good company to join for a fresh graduate student.
cons: langeauge is the big problem. i was sent to a brunch and rotate four jobs in that brunch.

headline: Nice working environment, good place for learning
pros:
People are friendly,
Have other allowance for housing, meal and mobile.
Job is secure, no any form of salary cut at economic downturn.
cons:
7x24 support is assumed. 
High pressure. 
Salary is not as good as other banks with similar duties.

headline: nothing special
pros: stable life, working hours not too long
cons: management needs improving. kind of disordered

headline: People-oriented culture but low efficiency
pros: relaxing working environment, friendly co-workers
cons: low efficiency, slow promotion, low commission and bonus, out-dated technology, old-fashioned

headline: Working in Bank of China (H.K) about 1 year
pros: Stable of work, no need to worry being lays off.
cons: Quality of call list is not good, difficult to meet target.

headline: officer trainee
pros: Pretty gd salary for a fresh graduate.
cons: something wrong in the sales target, unfair situation

headline: Mediocrity at its best
pros: Stable, has resources, lots of deal flows
cons: Be wary of your colleagues and it is extremely bureaucratic. I have never encountered an HR department that is as incompetent as BOCHK's. All they can ever think of is to get in the way of your work, waste your time and ALWAYS SAY NO. They can't seem to use the thing in their head to think of SOLUTIONS. I never thought their is a job where people are paid to say NO to everything. The HR department gives you a small preview of what to expect when you start fulltime.
